name: Antonica
notes: Home to the city of Qeynos, the dungeon of Blackburrow and haunted fortress of Stormhold.

objects.name: The Ulteranis
objects.subtext: Indentations of five rings encircle the smooth crystal of Ulteranis.

book_pages.text: Within the storage box you find a leather bound manifest.  It appears to be untouched for quite some time, but the leather is still in excellent condition.

The manifest once belonged to a hunter, that apparently had something to do with organizing hunts for Qeynosian royalty.  Great hunts were organized, where hunters from all over Norrath were invited to participate, competing for prizes and prestige.  The manifest is not particularly well written, but it sparks your imagination nonetheless.

actions.label: I will hunt game in Antonica.

npcs.name: Able Tucksmeet
utterances: Darathar awaits, do you dare!?

npcs.name: Abram Calvern
utterances: Greetings Traveler, you ever heard of the Necrosis Goblin Clan?

They are evil little goblins. They break into Qeynos through the old condemned catacombs. That is why Sir Dinzzie and the rest of us are here. Be cautious if you ever do find yourself near the buggers!

store.gamelink: \aITEM 345620375 1689498067:a goblin's notebook - History of the Condemned Catacomb\/a

npcs.name: Addison
utterances: Have I got a deal for you!
Good day, adventurer. Care to take a look at my merchandise?
Hello, friend. Welcome to my shop.

npcs.name: Addson
utterances: Good day, adventurer. Care to take a look at my merchandise?
Have I got a deal for you!
Hello, friend. Welcome to my shop.

npcs.name: Aldritch
utterances: Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!
Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.
Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Angelina McQuibble
utterances: Hello there.

npcs.name: Aroof Wolfchaser
utterances: Hail!
Thanks!
What?!
Yeah!
Hail to you too!
What? Where?
Urrp, ello there, why are there two of you...

npcs.name: Barstan Rheyble
utterances: Some of what I sell may not be meant for you, not yet at least.
Hmmm... let me get a closer look. Ah, yes, yes this is part of a set. I know the stories well, Sabertooth legends.

If you were to believe the story they would give a gnoll leader the power to forever unite all gnolls of Norrath. That is what the tradition states now. I studied it, however, and the original promise was simply one of ancestral support to one worthy of such a thing. Kind of romantic, especially for a gnoll.

No mention of what form this support came in, either. I believe the clan has had all the objects in the set for some time now. Occasionally a gnoll will claim enough victories that the powers that be will allow him a chance at speaking with the ancestors and receiving their support. It hasn't happened that I know of, but I am hardly on speaking terms with the gnolls, hah hah!

It's simple. One collects the five symbols of Pack Jhen'Tur: the miniature scepter, the small metal figure, the bone carving, the petrified bark, and the small cube. Once one has all of these trinkets they will place them upon the Stone of Graw--which is supposed to be in Antonica, but near the heart of the gnolls, or so they say.
Ancestral support...? I'm not sure, neither are the gnolls. It's all theory after that.
Anytime. Be well.

npcs.name: Blarton Blumble
utterances: Oh, you've found it! Thank you so much! I didn't think I'd ever get it back. I don't know how I can repay you. I'm in your debt, friend.

Hello again! Thanks again for finding my lure for me. I can't wait to get back to fishin' my old spots as soon as my leg is healed. I've been cooped up here longer than I had hoped and I just can't stop wondering how my favorite spots are right now. Are the fish biting? Have the gnolls fished 'em out yet? I can't stand not knowing! Can you please go check my fishin' spots for me and let me know how they are?

Oh, thank you so much. If I can't get out there and fish, at least I can find out what's going on. Here, let me see that journal you've got there and I'll write down all my favorite spots for you. Mind you, I'd take it as a favor if you don't go showin' this to anyone else. These spots are nice and quiet and I'd like to keep 'em that way.
I couldn't bear to go through all this time healing only to finally get back out there and have a crowd of people fishin' in my spot.
What? Oh, hello there.
Thank you so much!
Why, hello there! Pleased to meet you, friend. I do hope you're having a better day than I am. With my leg being as it is, I'm not sure how much longer I can take being stuck here.

Ah, I can't believe I was such a darn fool. How'd I manage to hurt my leg and lose my best fishin' lure all in one day? There I was up on the coast, north of here, having a nice walk before settling down for a long day of fishin' when I slipped and hurt my poor leg.

It hurt somethin' fierce and I only barely managed to drag myself back here. The next morning I found I could stand on it okay, but not for too long. I thought I'd try to do some fishin' here at this nice pond since I'm stuck until I can heal enough to get back to my favorite fishin' holes. Just as I was getting set up, I realized I'd lost my favorite lure! I must have dropped it somewhere up on the beach north of here near where I fell. With my leg like this, I can't go and look for it myself. I don't suppose you might be able to help find it for me?
Hello again! Please hurry back when you're done.

Wonderful! Thank you for checking on my spots for me. It sounds like it would be a great fishing day if I could make it out there. At least now I know everything's fine and most of my favorite places are teeming with fish and are still as quiet as ever.

I'm sorry to trouble you again after all that you've done, but I need you to find a specific fish for me. I've been trying to catch him for a long time now, but he's a cunning old devil and he always gets away.

His name is Ol' One Eye. He's been living in these waters for some time and has eluded many a would-be fisherman. Can you go look for him and let me know if he's still out there? I just can't stop wonderin' where he is.
Thanks again, friend. Please, don't try to catch or harm him. I've been waiting a long time to catch up with him and I want to catch him myself. Good luck with the search!

Ahh, so he's still out there lurking. I'll just have to rest up and save my strength so I can get back to the hunt. I will catch him someday! I know it isn't enough for all that you've done for me, but please take this reward. Thank you so much for all your help!
Well, hello again. It's good to see you. I don't suppose that you can offer me a little more assistance?

My cousin had a tin of bait for me, but he left it sitting at an abandoned camp to the south of here while he was out and about. Now I hear some gnolls have moved in. Do you think you can pick up the bait for me?
Thank you, and good luck.

npcs.name: a bloated skeleton
utterances: You made your final mistake.
It's only a minor setback.
There can be no end to us.
Going somewhere?
The living wander too close.

npcs.name: a Bloodsaber Corruptor
utterances: Who are you?

npcs.name: Bobby McQuibble
utterances: Yes?

npcs.name: Breeza Harmet
utterances: Hello, traveler!  I'm sorry about the mess. I'm carving a set of chess pieces, but I'm almost finished. Please, I'll only be a few minutes. Won't you listen to my story of the chessboard of Stormguard? I must know if it's only a story or if it bears any truth!

I love carving and shaping the wood, but I enjoy the game even more. It's nice to sit in the warm sun playing chess with a friend. And talking about real queens and knights! Which reminds me ...   Did you know that the Knights of Thunder played chess, too? I heard stories that they hold their banquets upon a giant chessboard!  Oh, that'd be wonderful to see!

npcs.name: Bulvar Rakgam
utterances: Yes? Do you bring me news?
Odd little thing. Did it come from a gnoll?
I thought so. I do not know what to make of it, but Barstan Rheyble might, he studies these things.
Just below me, outside the keep but still on the island. I hope he can help.
I am Bulvar, you must be <player name>. Am I correct?
Indeed. I have heard of the help you have provided me, I am quite thankful.
Save your manners. Thanking you was not the reason I called you here. I wish to ask for your help once again.

The Sabertooth gnolls are growing bolder each day. Magnon and Tyllia--both with your help--provided me with a great deal of information. Under the banner of the Sabertooth, the Cavemaw and Darkpaw gnolls have been expanding their operations. I wanted to tell both Magnon and Tyllia this but I have twice had gnolls attack my couriers--this is not normal.

That was my first question too. Fast, efficient trade routes have been opened up between Blackburrow and Antonica. I don't know the precise plans of the gnolls that remain in Blackburrow. The gnolls in Antonica, however, seem to be preparing for a big offensive. They are not yet prepared for such an action, but they will be soon. This is why I ordered Magnon to hold off on further exploration of the cave.

Exactly. The gnolls aren't smart, but they're not stupid either. The plan for this offensive isn't some kind of raid meant to get supplies, but rather a permanent move into the open of Antonica. The gnolls want to expand their caved cities into every mountain and hill. Now, obviously the people of Antonica would never let this happen--but the gnolls aren't smart enough to realize that. They will attempt it and many lives will be lost.
Not very soon. If we need, we have plenty of time to prepare. However, I would prefer to stop it before it even starts, and that is where you come in.

I've been managing some units of the Qeynos Guard. I have had them watching a number of gnoll encampments across Antonica. Many of these gnolls will make up a sizable portion of the army the gnolls hope to amass. Soon I will give the word to strike. While I'm doing that I need your help on the battlefield but at a higher level.

I have intelligence that points me to five gnolls who will play very specific roles in this plot. Once you have taken them out we will allow word to reach the camps. As that occurs the guards will decimate the camps, leaving a few gnolls alive so that the rest will hear their stories. The blow to their morale should be enough to put this plot on the backburner for good.

The first is Animator Z'Apha. There is a farm just southwest of here. Z'Apha has been sending scarecrows into the fields of Antonica. He hasn't acted yet, but I do not want to wait for that. Head down to that farm, kill eight of his rotstuffed scarecrows, and put an end to Animator Z'Apha.
Return to me once you've finished.
Z'Apha and his minions?
Good, good. Are you ready for the next one?

Good. Bra'ak the Reptile has been training gnolls in the hills north of here. He's a skilled assassin and we need to take him out before his knowledge has sunk too far into the ranks of the Sabertooth gnolls. Kill him and six of the Sabertooth darkstriders that share his camp. You can find him in the rocky hills north of here--just south west of the Vale of Shattering.
We will all feel safer with him out of the picture. Be safe, <player name>.
Do you have news?
Most excellent, <player name>. Our work is progressing. Are you ready for the next gnoll?

Tactician Mengs has always been--at least by gnoll standards--a military genius. You can find him in the tunnel that leads to the Steppes far to the south west. It rests behind the waterfall at the southern end of the river to our west. Kill him and his guards.
It is my guess that he is the one who planned the Antonican siege. With him out of the way I do not believe the gnolls can properly handle a dynamic battlefield.
The tactician?
Excellent. Are you ready for an easy break? Our latest reports place the final two gnolls in the same location.

North west of here. Graalwen and Jayl'Krik. There is a mountain just this side of the river. Upon that mountain Graalwen and Jayl'Krik have set up temporary camps. They are task masters from Blackburrow and are being sent to the Cavemaw and Darkpaw packs. For now they are in their camps with a number of guards. When you go for them, also take out a number of the camp and spear guards. To break the Blackburrow elite will be a great psychological victory.
Good luck, <player name>.
There is not much in this land that can surprise a well prepared adventurer.

npcs.name: a Caltorsis cleric
utterances: You cannot kill what is already dead!
You will see us again in your nightmares!

npcs.name: a Caltorsis magi
utterances: That pile of bones was my friend!
Sleep.
Rest in peace.
Final death comes at last.
The rest has come.

npcs.name: a Caltorsis watchman
utterances: You cannot eliminate us!
That pile of bones was my friend!
Your eyes are so pretty.

npcs.name: Camden
utterances: Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.
Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Cantile Digglefiz
utterances: Chopping, chopping, chopping! This is an excellent way to take ones mind off of things!

npcs.name: Captain Beltho
utterances: On your way -- unless you're here on official business.  I've got enough work here for ten men, and only two at my disposal!
I have no report, because there's nothing to report. We've had no luck finding the hidden entrance to the gnolls' lair. I need more time and more men to track them down.

I appreciate your help. I'd like you to search the most southern lands. One of our scouts mentioned seeing gnolls in the area, and another scout mentioned a number of bridges connecting the islands. It's probably another dead end, but if you do find the gnoll lair, return to me and I'll finish the report.
Well done indeed! I'll finish the report, along with your description of the area, and you may take it to Captain Eitoa.

npcs.name: Captain Eitoa
utterances: I wouldn't mind chatting with you in Irontoe's East, but here I've got work to do.
Good.  I worry about our outposts, especially the ones that... well, let's just say I'm relieved.  At any rate, here's a bit of coin from the city's coffers. Qeynos thanks you for your service.
I do.  I need someone to check with Captain Beltho at Gnollslayer Keep and return with his report about the gnolls.  I hope he's made progress since the last one.

It's a fair distance, but not hard to find. Take the south path around the mountain range that splits Antonica.  Once you cross the bridge at the far side of the valley, follow the river a hundred cogs or so, then turn east until you see a small keep with a moat. Captain Beltho should be there. If he's not, I'll want to know why he's not at his post.

There is something you can do. I've posted a guard at the Keep of the Ardent Needle, and he hasn't been reporting to me as often as I'd like. Would you go inspect the keep and make sure everything is in order?
Give me a moment to read over this...  Finally, some real progress! Beltho mentions your involvement with finding the hidden entrance to the gnoll lair. Well done!
Don't underplay your skills.  Without your help, Beltho would still be searching for the hidden entrance to the lair. Take this signet ring as a mark of my gratitude and trust.

I was prepared to send several of my men to the Thundering Steppes with a message to Captain Sturman.  My troops here are already spread thin warding off gnoll attacks. If you could deliver the message to the Captain, I can keep my men on duty.
Thank you for serving Qeynos. Take this communique to Captain Sturman at Bridge Keep.  It's to the east in the Thundering Steppes.  Be careful, you will be traveling through gnoll territory.

I know. I've alerted the officials about the problems at Bridge Keep.  Unfortunately, they won't provide more men, and we can't spare any of our troops. But thank you for delivering me the message, nonetheless. Sturman is a strong fighter and a smart leader; that's why he's been stationed in the Thundering Steppes. He'll protect his people.
I appreciate your help. Here is a small payment from the Qeynos treasury. It's not much, but it's all I'm authorized to compensate you.
I heard the Bloodsabers are causing problems for Wesealen, but I didn't realize he was so entangled in the matter. Has he enlisted you?
Well, let me have a look at this letter of yours.

Why, this reveals the time and place of an upcoming Bloodsaber gathering!  This is valuable information indeed!  You are to be commended.  I wish I could spare a few warriors to assist you, but I cannot.  Still, Antonica needs you to subdue the Bloodsabers before the village folk become panicked.

Then make haste to the old mill on Windstalker Pond.  Seek out Riason Hanagom ... and kill him.  He is one of their leaders, and a traitor against Qeynos.  After you have finished the deed, return to me and give me any further information you have discovered.  This is urgent.
This letter cannot be read.  It must've been enspelled with a cipher.  Take it to the tower, and find a magi who can unlock the code.  We need to know what this says before we plan our next move.

I've heard he has talent.  Hmm ... interesting.  There's a plan to join forces with something called the Dark Coven -- a cabal of renegade priests and magis.  The Bloodsabers have sent a courier to meet them.  Shall we foil this plan?

You must stop that courier. A union between the Bloodsabers and the Dark Coven would be terrible for our fair city. Take the south road, and hurry. I will speak with Wesaelen, and see if he has uncovered more information.
Go then.  You'll find the Keep on the north side of the ridge, just this side of the Tower of the Oracles. It's one of the few keeps in pristine condition.

npcs.name: a Cavemaw grub hunter
utterances: Kill it!
Uh oh... That's not good.
Attack!
More Qeynos food!
Go with Fippy, fallen one!

npcs.name: a Cavemaw rock melter
utterances: Not allowed here!
Bite! Show sharp teeth!
Another member of the pack down!
That one will never mate!

utterances: Bite! Show sharp teeth!
Another member of the pack down!
That one will never mate!
Spin, weave, dodge, attack!!!

utterances: Not allowed here!
Another member of the pack down!
Spin, weave, dodge, attack!!!
Bite! Show sharp teeth!
That one will never mate!
That one never mate!

npcs.name: Conall Lancebreaker
utterances: Hail, right back at ya.
Grab an ale, me friend!
I should be gettin' back to me wife, before she comes callin' after me... again.

npcs.name: Cooper
utterances: Feel free to browse my wares... or perhaps you're interested in selling some of yours? Say... no, never mind.

How perceptive of you to notice that I am in dire need of aid. A... close friend of mine... has requested news from the city and, sadly, I've not the time to deliver the repo... err... letter I have for him.

Truly a lifesaver! Deliver this to Riason Hanagom, no need to return here when you're finished. Tell him that he'll need to pay you for your services. Do try not to look at it. The letter is rather personal and I would feel awkward if someone else were to read it.

npcs.name: Corporal Peckett
utterances: Hail, adventurer. I must warn you that Coldwind Point is not the safest place. Most of the garrison is on the march and the gnolls have been sighted nearby. I cannot guarantee your safety.

npcs.name: Dancer
utterances: You must be an adventurer who's new to these parts. Who else would brave the wilds so far from the watchful eye of the Qeynos Guard?
Adventurer ... explorer ... how would you like to be a courier too?

I prefer the term frontierslady, but who am I to argue with a legendary adventurer. Please take this note to Sighard Sayer, proprietor of Sayer's Outfitters, the frontier trading post just to the north of here.
Now, can you take that arrow and apply it to a training dummy in Archer Woods? Search for the dummy with the symbol of a golden tree and green arrow.
The arrow is a special marker for some friends of mine.
Thank you, courier. I trust you have done as I requested. If not, Trusaris will tell me. He sees all in Archer Woods, including your every step.
Trusaris is the great oak of Archer Woods. He has lived in these hills for many ages. He has seen much grief in his lifetime. Now gnolls are taking over what is left of his home.
You think you can clear all of Archer Woods? I doubt that, but I would be glad to see you try, as would Trusaris.

npcs.name: a dankfur dock warden
utterances: You will not ruin our lands!
I'll rip your throat open!

npcs.name: a dankfur gnoll
utterances: Spin, weave, dodge, attack!!!
Not allowed here!
To arms!
That one died.
That one never mate!
Kill it!  Kill it!
Bite! Show sharp teeth!
You gonna die so fast!
Another member of the pack down!
That one will never mate!
You gonna pay for that.
I must fight for Sabertooth pride.

drops.gamelink: \aITEM -1161459075 1625987143:a small bronze key with a strange handle\/a

npcs.name: a Dark Coven conjuror
utterances: Thule's blood! You'll pay for that!
I hope that doesn't happen to me!

npcs.name: a Dark Coven witch
utterances: I hope that doesn't happen to me!
Thule's blood! You'll pay for that!

npcs.name: a Darkpaw animator
utterances: More Qeynos food!
Go with Fippy, fallen one!

npcs.name: a Darkpaw brigand
utterances: Kill it!  Kill it!
I must fight for Sabertooth pride.
You're stronger than me.
You gonna die so fast!

utterances: Bite! Show sharp teeth!
Not allowed here!
Another member of the pack down!
That one will never mate!
That one never mate!
Spin, weave, dodge, attack!!!

npcs.name: The Darkpaw Fanglord
utterances: Attack!
Uhhhh... I think I go now!

More Qeynos food!

utterances: Uh oh... That's not good.

npcs.name: a Darkpaw mystic
utterances: Attack!
Go with Fippy, fallen one!
More Qeynos food!
Uhhhh... I think I go now!
Awoooooo!
Kill it!

utterances: That one will never mate!
That one never mate!

utterances: Another member of the pack down!
