npcs.name: Darmen Sproutmore
utterances: Hail to you, adventurer! Mind your feet, and don't step on my dear little flowers! Just coming into bloom, they are.

Thank you!  Gardening is my life.  I love tending the small, green things of the earth.  Why, some of these sprouts shall be tall trees one day.  And, many of my plants, will soon feed the people of Qeynos.  Hmm ... makes one wonder, though.  What do you suppose fed those Knights of Thunder so long ago?

Oh, come now!  Surely you have heard the rumors that some explorers believe they found the location of the legendary Stormhold? ... The ancient fortress of the Knights of Thunder?  Personally, I think those "explorers" were crypt raiders, but what do I know?  Plants.  That's what I know.  And no one ever saw the Knights of Thunder growing their own plants ...  or hauling supply wagons out of Qeynos for that matter.  So, how do you suppose they fed themselves?  Hmm?
That's very generous of you.  I'm curious to a fault, you know.  However ... if you do go into Stormhold, please use caution.

npcs.name: Daryann Stormrider
utterances: Have you dealt with the creatures?
Thank you for your services.  You proved to be a valuable member of the community here in Windstalker Village. Good luck in your future endeavors.  Please take this small token of our appreciation.
I watch over the woodlands and keep nature in balance. Sometimes it's an unpleasant and difficult task, but without hunters, the hunted would overrun our land.

Each village has someone who decides which creatures' numbers need culling and what populations are stable. I'm the representative for Windstalker Village. If you wish to help me, I will gladly assign you some tasks.

Sometimes a population grows rapidly, and we must hunt weak and sickly creatures to ensure others in the population remain healthy. Other times, predators disrupt nature's balance. I need you to hunt sea turtles and darkclaw crabs near our shores and any red tail hawks you come across here in Antonica.  Please return to me when you finish.
Thanks to your help.  The populations in Antonica are somewhat stabilized.  At least, for now.

npcs.name: David Torchsong
utterances: I greet you, great adventurer!  Isn't it wonderful!?
Our lost goddess of love has returned to us!  I was heartbroken by the news of her demise, but now that she has returned, love and compassion can take a grander hold upon us all.
Isn't it wondrous?  Love has proven that it cannot be conquered by death!  I feel like celebrating.  Don't you?

I was thinking that we could perform some grand miracles of love in Norrath.  The resulting emotions will then be released -emotions, like love and compassion, giving glory and strengthening our Lady of Love.  Would you like to help me perform these miracles of love?
Delightful!  I know of several in town that could truly benefit from the glow of love within their lives, and others that have come to me looking for help finding that special someone.
Isn't it exciting!?  I'll give you the names of the townsfolk that you should speak to.  Talk with them a while and find out who would be best coupled together, based upon what they say.

npcs.name: a decaying skeleton
utterances: Sleep.
The rest has come.

npcs.name: a defiled squire
utterances: Your eyes are so pretty.
Seek death and it finds you.
Your blood calls to me.
Final death comes at last.
Rest in peace.
You've shaken the dust from my bones.

npcs.name: Dillan Bolefreg
utterances: Hello. You in the market for some food?
Just the old key I have. It supposedly goes to a condemned catacomb that the Guards of Qeynos no longer watch over. Maybe an adventure there for you?
Sure, just let me know when you want to buy it.
You there, I might have something you want to buy...

npcs.name: a distressed merchant
utterances: I beg of you to help me.  These foul beasts have blocked off my escape.  Help me out and I'll help you in return.

npcs.name: Duffy
utterances: Take a look around. Never have you seen such finely crafted or wondrous artifacts for sale ... for such little coin!

npcs.name: Dury Buntan
utterances: Welcome! Is there anything I can help you with or are you looking to find an apprenticeship?
Hello there, my fine adventurer.  Just give me that armor right quick and I'll hammer it up good as new!

npcs.name: Dworn Soulforge
utterances: Oh ho!  I ain't got time to stop and chat, laddie!  These darn gnolls sprout up faster 'n I can keep 'em down, and my eyes ain't so good as they used to be.  Be fast!  What'cha need?

npcs.name: Edwards
utterances: If I know you adventuring types, you'll need one of these.
Good day, adventurer. Care to take a look at my merchandise?
Hello, friend. Welcome to my shop.

npcs.name: Eenekie Blazdine
utterances: Thank the stars that you are here! I've been looking for a worthy assistant that can help.
The Necrosis goblin clan, they have found their way into the condemned catacomb below us and have been stealing the artifacts. The Concordium needs your help in retrieving these artifacts.

npcs.name: Ethurien
utterances: There are many journeys in life.  Somehow, the one that always seems the longest is the one that leads you home.
At the end of the day, do you find yourself weary and wishing you could simply return home?  My friend, I can offer you a chance to do just that.

All life is connected through various means, some visible and some not.  We Erudites have studied the multitude of relationships between the physical and magical.  You will need to take a vessel with you when you go.

You will go many places.  First, seek that which time cannot erase.  All the physical matter around us is shaped and formed through its influence.  Clear or dark, weak or strong, it is most essential to all living beings.
Of course not!  If it were that easy, any idiot would have figured this out ages ago! What do they teach you youngsters in school these days anyway?
My apologies!  Your second step is to examine that which surrounds us all.  The more there is, the less there seems to be.  Hold this vessel aloft and revel in its nothingness.

Do not fear the third step, for only those without the power to reason will be alarmed.  Take the vessel to a place you have seen many times before and yet not experienced.  Rise above all else and strike when the iron is hot!
Tread carefully, for someday you will become one with that with which the vessel must be filled.  This must be done by sunset of the third day or you shall fail.
Fine, fine.  Take your time.  More information I am writing into your journal so that you will not forget these things.  Do not be afraid of the journey, my friend, for it shall lead you home.

npcs.name: Farmer Gerrit
utterances: These farms help Qeynos get the food it needs to help function.  It's a hard life sometimes, but well worth it.

npcs.name: Farmer Helver
utterances: These farms provide a lot of necessary food to Qeynos.  It's a lot of work, but it is rewarding.

Ah, hello, adventurer.  I'm sure you're here to stop a dragon, or invading orcs, or a swarm of giant bees or something, no doubt!  I'm sorry, but there's nothing too exciting happening out here.  Just farming.
Oh, well, okay then!  What do you need?
Well of course it never came... we never got paid!  I'd love to send this food before it spoils, but I can't feed and clothe my own family on goodwill alone.
Not a single copper.  It's not usual for the Queen's payments to be late, but a deal is a deal.  Until I get the payment, I can't very well ship off this for free.
There's a clerk in the bank... Feld is his name, I think.  He usually passes us the money on these transactions.  You could check with him.
Ah, hello again, friend.  What brings you out this way?
Oh?  What is that?
Really?  Oh, this is odd.  Usually the clerks send a representative from the bank, but as long as we're getting our payment, I'll make sure the food gets to the city.  Thanks for your help.

npcs.name: Farmer Walcott
utterances: Oh! My poor crops! What will I do with all these ravenous beetles scurrying about?
I saw a moat rat chewing that slip this morning. I thought I would never get it back! You must be an amazing hero to face moat rats with such ease!
I can use a person with your strength and bravado. See those evil looking scarecrows in my fields? I sure would appreciate it if you would get rid of 'em for me.
Just a minute here ... this looks like a child's sketch of me fields! Just what was this gnoll doing?
Aha! Recently, my scarecrows came to life with fierce rage! I had no idea how this happened. I think I know how I can fight it.
You can handle the wilderness better than a simple farmer. I'll need a few components. Collect them for me so I can begin my plan.
Thank you for your help, adventurer. There was no way a simple farmer could face such creatures and live. Now maybe I can get some work done around here.
A beetle charmer would be grand -- if there were such a thing. I would be satisfied just hiring an adventurer to stomp a bunch of the beetles. Oh my poor barley!
Thank the lost gods! I know you can't exterminate all these pests, but please do your best. I'll reward you with what I can. Don't worry, little barley ... help is on the way.
Yes! You did a great job, adventurer! The crops live another day. Please take this for your kind deeds.
Fantastic! Now I can bring to life a good scarecrow, one who I can place in the fields and who will destroy the evil ones!

npcs.name: Flores
utterances: Step right up! My wares stand up to any found in the city!  Made by the finest Qeynosian crafters, they are!

I certainly do. I need to deliver supplies to a couple of my merchants out in the far reaches of Antonica.  Business is so good right now that I hate to close up shop. How would you like to deliver their supplies?

npcs.name: Geddard
utterances: Welcome to Gnollslayer Keep!  I'm Geddard, the only merchant for leagues.  If I don't got it, you don't need it!  What'll it be for you today?

npcs.name: Gerd Noale
utterances: I mean really, what kind of dwarf is forced by their own stomach not to drink!

npcs.name: Ghil Ventur
utterances: How can I help you?

npcs.name: Ghost of Vhalen
utterances: I stand vigilant to ring the bells in warning for the city of Qeynos.
You cannot kill what is already dead!

npcs.name: Gol M'Tun
utterances: Stand away, fool! Long live the Queen!

npcs.name: a gratified merchant
utterances: That was very brave of you!  I need to leave soon, but I can offer my services in the meantime.

npcs.name: a griffin tamer
utterances: Greetings traveler, how can I assist you today?

npcs.name: a griffon tamer
utterances: Where would you like to go?

npcs.name: a grime covered savage
utterances: Cover me while we regroup!
Don't break! Hold the line!
I'll eat your heart for your cowardice!
Don't fear death! There is no surrender!
Alarm!  Skirmishers approaching!

npcs.name: Grolven Chiptooth
utterances: Kill it!
Uhhhh... I think I go now!

npcs.name: Haddek Vimki
utterances: So, then I said, "That's what the Gnome is for!"  Wraahaahaa! Huh? What? If you're goin' to come over here and badger me, why don't you make yourself useful?
Ahhh, Aroof... He's a good chap, but he's about as smart as a trog. Me an' the big guy here are in the middle of something. What do you want?

Ya see, twinkletoes over here has had quite a bit to drink. The big oaf isn't as coordinated as the barkeep would like him to be. Seems last time I sent him up to get us another round, he tripped over a ratonga sitting by the bar.

... And, it turns out the ratonga had what you might call... financial responsibilities to take care of for the proprietor. Looks like the little fur ball won't be back for quite some time! Hraahaha! The barkeep will throw us both out if the big guy over here comes stumbling upstairs one more time. Besides, I don't think he's feeling up to going anywhere right now.

You're an impatient one, aren't you? You need to slow down a bit! Sit back, grab an ale, and enjoy the sights. Get up you drunken fool! You know, when I was a young pup like yourself I used to be all over Norrath fighting Drakota... with my bare hands.

And look where it got me. Sitting here with a drunken fool who can't keep both feet on the ground, and talking to a whelp like you. Where was I?  Aye, I want a drink! Why don't you grab the big guy and I an ale.
I'll tell ya what I need when you get back.

Hruh? What? I thought I told you what I wanted from you. If you're not going to take care of it I'm going to have old Aroof here take care of... Well... it don't look like he is going to be taking care of much... but when I tell him tomorrow, he will be awful angry!
Ahhh. That's some wretched stuff right there. Aroof isn't going to tolerate slop like this. Looks like I will have to just drink it for him.

Hey there! Good to see you again! Care to do an old dwarf another favor? I'm making something special, but I need some help getting a few of the ingredients. But, you see, I'm not quite as young as I used to be, and I need a bit of help. Sometimes I wonder why I waste my time with this fool.
Right, right. You see, I have this, let's call him, "friend."  This "friend" has been giving me and Aroof here a hard time. I got something in mind for him, and I need your help.

You see, Blarton put something in our drinks, and whatever it is has got big, tough Aroof over here in quite a mess. We need to get back at Blarton! I got this idea for a wine... something that will really knock his socks off.
Good, good! I need to get some goo from the risen protectors. Go pick me up some of that stuff an' I'll make it worth your while.
Bring it straight back to me.
Ha! Great! Why don't you take this? It doesn't look like old Aroof will be needing it. Hmph!

Shhhh! Do you have to be so loud? Look, here's what I need from you. I think that Aroof over here has a bit of a hangover. Ha! Think you can help him out a bit? I would do it, but I've got to stay around and help the poor guy out.

Why don't you be a pal and grab my friend here what I, er... he needs to get rid of this horrendous, terrible, splitting headache. But, bring it to me. I need to give it a taste first before he tries it. I'm a good friend, ya know. I've got to make sure he'll like it.
Great! An' hurry on up, I can't be waiting all day. I mean, it pains me to see Aroof in such a mess. Go on now!

npcs.name: Hartok Woolyman
utterances: Hello, adventurer! Would you care for a nice bearskin rug for your abode? I made them myself. If you don't want one, get lost! I have things to do.
Looking for work, huh? I think I can find something for you to do. You see, I make these here bearskin rugs, and I am finding less and less time to gather the pelts myself. Perhaps you can help.

Look, don't get ahead of yourself. It's not like Holly Windstalker is going to be chasing you down for killing her precious bears! Ha! As a matter of fact, I have been killing every bear I have seen for years, and nothing has stopped me yet!

I need you to kill some bears for me, of course. You see, I have so many orders to fill, I can't even think of going out and getting them myself. So, from time to time, I look to adventurers such as yourself to help me out a little bit.

There are plenty of bears out around these parts. These parts were protected for so long, it seems like it's instinct for them to come here and gather. Business is booming and there is no end of supply in sight!

You did it! Thank you so much, friend. I must have just been imagining things. To think, I actually thought that somehow old Holly Windstalker sent that creature after me. Can you believe it? I guess sometimes those old myths can get to even the best of us. Now, I can get back to business. I have lots of orders to fill! Haha!
Thanks again! I think I'll be safe for the time being.

npcs.name: Henry Maxwell Denalis
utterances: Hello.

npcs.name: a Heroes' Festival promoter
utterances: Don't you just love a good celebration?

npcs.name: a highwayman
utterances: I see an attacker!  Sound the alarm!
You must flee!  I'll try to hold them.
Cover me while we regroup!
Fall back in formation, and regroup at the rendezvous.
All hands retreat!
We're losing. We must stop their momentum!
We have no hope. We must withdraw!
We must withdraw before we all die!
Send for reinforcements!  Their warriors are skilled.
I've been wounded.  I'll need assistance!
Keep up the assault, no matter what the cost in lives!
Summon help, intruders have arrived!

npcs.name: Historian Rotpaw
utterances: What is it you need?  What can be so important as to interrupt my day?

npcs.name: Hubbard
utterances: Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.
Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.
I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.

npcs.name: Hucklethin Gorsefoot
utterances: By leaf and lake, it's another fine day in Antonica!

npcs.name: Hwal Rucksif
utterances: Ho, there!  You wouldn't mind helping out a hard working dwarf, would ya?
Ya see, I've been tasked with gettin' a whole bunch of fine weapons made for the sentries out here, and me achin' back is already at its limit.  Argh!  These boots chafe something awful!

Much thanks to ya, stranger!  I'm not sure I could finish the job without your help!  I need plenty of iron and wood for these weapons.  It's a lot of work, but I'm sure that together we can get it done in half the time that it'd take me to do it alone!
Ahh, you're back!  My now, that's a serious load of iron and wood!
Easy now!  Don't go dropping it all over! I'll just have to pick it up later!
Har har har!  Don't tell me that!  I have to do this all day long!  The forge is a cruel mistress, but she rewards well!
I've got some coin for ya, but how about I enlist you to help with another task?  What's that? Yes? Great!

The captain of the guards requested I forge a rather special sword, and I'm having a slight problem finding the materials I need.  That's a dandy little book you've got there; I'll just write down what I need.
Ahh, too much to do here!  There's no way I can get it all done!

npcs.name: Ignar Steadirt
utterances: The great Qeynos Claymore -- folks come from all over to pray here.
I came here seeking strength to defeat my enemies.

I pray for the strength to conquer the undead, but they are not just my enemies; the undead are the enemies of us all.  Several days ago, patrols were sent to see how our battle against the undead was faring.  And I -- I have the most disagreeable task of all.  I have to stand here and wait for the reports to return.  Me! Standing around waiting when there's undead to cleave! Pah!
That's why I'm praying. Perhaps my prayers have been answered.  Are you here to help me?
Excellent. Are you ready to start?

I need those darned dispatches brought back to me! You'd think that folks who get to run around looking for danger would realize how important it is to send word back to ... well, me.  Since they haven't, I need someone to knock them upside their heads and get the information, then bring it back to me.
That is a shame. Please leave me to my prayers.
Got all three reports for me, eh?

npcs.name: Inane Rain
utterances: We are pleased to have you with us, <player name>!

npcs.name: Isdemus Hamest
utterances: What can I do ya fer?

npcs.name: Jarvis
utterances: Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: Jenkins
utterances: I am rather busy.

npcs.name: Kagin Oathsmasher
utterances: If I was in yer boots, and sober, I'd venture o'er to Antonica and see Brell's avatar for meself.
Pass some more ale!

npcs.name: Kinamer Galemaul
utterances: Keep clear of the forge, my friend.  The metal is hot and my hammer swings where it will!

Aye!  Some think I'm dangerous in my old age, but I get the job done.  I never retired, you know.  Blacksmithing is in my blood... I gotta work now and then, keeps me young.  Ach!  But these worthless tools ... they make me mad as a wet cat!

Oh, nothing's wrong with them, I suppose.  It's just ... they're not the beloved tools I left behind in Kaladim.  Back then, we dwarves knew how to make tools.  Not like today. If only I had a smithy like the one in that fabled Stormhold, I would never retire!

Why, a smithy is the workshop of a blacksmith!  And Stormhold -- the legendary fortress of the Knights of Thunder -- had the greatest smithy outside Kaladim!  Underforge it was called.  It produced all the arms and armor, and kept the Knights' horses shod.  Say ... you've heard the rumors, haven't you?  Some rapscallion crypt raiders found Stormhold, or so everyone claims.  I put no faith in rumors, but I'd be grateful to anyone who would find out the truth for me.
Thank you much.  A rumor's not worth a heap of slag ... but sometimes you can find a grain of truth in a rumor.

npcs.name: Knight-Captain Antillin
utterances: I am Captain Antillin of the Coldwind Point Garrison. The roads ahead are infested with gnolls. No Antonican is safe. Turn back now.

npcs.name: Knight-Captain Antillin
utterances: I am Captain Antillin of the Coldwind Point Garrison. The roads ahead are infested with gnolls. No Antonican is safe. Turn back now.

npcs.name: Knight Grelda Stoneshearer
utterances: Stop right where you are, or I'll slit your throat, stranger!

Oh.  If Ignar sent you, then I can't kill you.  Pity.  Well, what did that old goat send you all the way out here for, eh?  He's not going to try swappin' assignments with me again, is he?  He's a good dwarf, good strategist ... shame about his hearing, though.  So, what is it?  Speak up!

Did you know those Sabertooth gnolls dug up a relic of ancient power?  Well, that's what they say anyhow.  I don't believe a word of it.  They're trying to scare off their competition by claiming it's a relic of Lord Grimrot himself!  Can you imagine?  What little fools they are, eh?  That's all I have to report.

npcs.name: Knight Grel Stoneshearer
utterances: And who might you be?

npcs.name: Knight-Lieutenant Alesso
utterances: Hello!  As you journey into the city, keep in mind that you may not enter the citadel within North Qeynos at this time.  You'll find better adventuring elsewhere.
Outside the gates of Qeynos, Antonica is riddled with vermin. Serve Qeynos by destroying these infectious beasts.
Rid Antonica of the rats, snakes and beetles that plague Qeynos.  Dispatch of no less than ten of each and we shall reward your service.
You served Qeynos well and shall be rewarded.

npcs.name: Knight Morte Winghammer
utterances: Hello!  It's such a pleasure to talk to someone else for a change!  What brings you this way from the big city, eh?

Did he? Ignar's such a good  person, you know. He stuck up for me when I joined the dwarven brigade, even though the other dwarves were a bit down on the idea.  Frankly, all I want out of this is a chance to learn some good blacksmithing.  That's what I really want to do, be a blacksmith.  I can't help but meet the right sort of folk for that in a dwarven unit, can I?  It's an absolutely brilliant idea, isn't it?

There are probably some good human blacksmiths, too, but I want to learn from the best of the best! I'm tickled that they consider me one of their own now!  Mostly.  The only downside is that I'm not meeting many women this way, but oh, well!  Once I start my own smithy, I'll be a hot man around town.  Get it? Ha!

Still, I can't decide whether they're just humoring me or not.  I get a lot of, "How's the weather up there?" and "Good day to be a dwarf, Longshanks!"  I have yet to meet any blacksmiths, either.  Maybe I've made a mistake after all ... d'you think?

Oh, right! My report!  Supposedly, someone's found Lord Grimrot's war scythe and is trying to raise him from the dead using its power.  Isn't it the oddest thing you ever heard?  Who'd want to bring back a dead guy who LOST a war?  I mean, if you're going to go through the trouble of bringing back the dead, go get one of the WINNERS, eh?  What?  You're leaving already?

npcs.name: Lambton
utterances: Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!
Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Landwyn Velamir
utterances: Do you know love, my friend?

How lucky I am. I have been holding this gift for my love for quite some time, but, alas, my duties keep me here. How sad it is that this flower shall wilt in the wait. Still, I am lucky, for her beauty shall never wane.

How does one compare the beauty of a goddess using the words of mere mortals? Her hair is the color of the rising sun, containing the most glorious hues of the dawn. Her skin is akin to porcelain, flawless and immaculate. Her eyes are the green of a springtime meadow, with small bursts like the yellow of daisies in their center. Her lithe body is soft and curved like the waves of the sea. I only wish my eyes could witness her beauty once again.
That would be splendid! Last I saw, there were some beneath a shaded tree north of here.
Please hurry!

npcs.name: Lanice
utterances: What can I get for you today?
What's your poison?

npcs.name: Laral Spenler
utterances: Greetings to -- You! You're the one I saw!
I mean in my dream. You were the one Morell-Thule revealed to me!

Well, it was after the abduction – Oh, you don't know about that! So, I was here, minding my own business, when I saw someone walking this way, having just exited Qeynos via the southern gate, over there.

They were wearing a mage's robe, so I figure they were one of the Concordium. Well, they got jumped by some winged brutes. They appeared out of nowhere! They grabbed the mage and flew off, before the guards could do anything!
Someone dropped this scroll. Now I don't know if it was the attackers or the attacked though. It is magically sealed with the symbol of 'the Three'.
I held on to it, thinking someone might offer a reward or something for recovering it, but then Morell-Thule revealed you and your agents to me in a dream!

You were in a droag village, in the shadow of Skyshrine, with this scroll. I don't know if that's where the attackers are from, or if that's where you're supposed to take the scroll, but when it comes to the Celestial Order, I know what's best for my skin. This is yours to deal with now!
I have faith the gods pointed me toward you for a reason. You'll do what's needed. Let Morell-Thule visit someone else!

npcs.name: Larissa Barone
utterances: My father left on a boat to help the refugees and hasn't returned.
The oracles told me my father would return, so I watch for his boat.

npcs.name: Licha
utterances: Turn around. Let me look you over.
I suppose you will have to do. There are things I need and surely no one expects me to dirty my flawless nails doing them. So, you will do them for me?

Do you know what a girl loves? By the blank look on your face, I would say no. Anyways, I adore everything that shines and sparkles. In fact, basilisks have the most wonderful shiny scales. I wanted one as a pet, but father said no.
Too dangerous for you, my strong, dirty adventurer? I think not! Bring me the shiniest scales you can find, and do it quickly.

Hardly.... Tell me, what dirt pile did you crawl out of? Your armor, if you can call it that, is filthy. Really, you should wash more. And you call that a weapon? I would be surprised if you could kill a lowly mouse with that thing.
Aren't you done yet?
Took you long enough.
Why is he so mean?
My father refuses to go pick up and pay for the new dress I ordered. How can I be seen wearing this old rag? I look like you! I want the new dress now!
The merchant will be arriving at the dock in The Thundering Steppes in a matter of seconds! Go and get it for me or I shall never be happy again! Go... NOW!
And be quick about it!

npcs.name: Lina
utterances: If you see something you need just let me know.

npcs.name: Lord Bennet
utterances: Welcome to the Keep of the Gnollslayers. We try to keep the roads and area clear from gnoll incursions.

npcs.name: Lord Kylar
utterances: Never trust a dwarf, that's what I always say.
Oh... yes, yes of course. Please excuse my words, I am stressed. Magnon sent you? What was your name again?

<player name>, wonderful. My son, Revyl, was outside honing his skills as a swordsman--he's quite good, remember his name, you'll be hearing it again in the future I assure you--when gnolls from who knows where dashed out and took him. I wasn't there myself, but I imagine he fought many off before they finally subdued him.

Well, they sent me a note asking for money for his return. Imagine that, gnolls trying to bargain. I sought Magnon out immediately. The note mentioned they would be south of the keep. Show them no mercy, <player name>, but do be careful.
I only hope Revyl is unharmed.
Thank you, thank you so much. Please return to Magnon and give him my thanks as well, though I know it was your doing more than his.
Son!
Thank you again.
Perhaps we will speak later... perhaps.

npcs.name: Lord Quinn Clothspinner
utterances: Welcome to the Keep of the Ardent Needle. You may rest here until I see fit to send you on your way.

npcs.name: Lord Rison
utterances: You cannot stop us all!
Feed on the fallen after we are victorious.
Why do you pester me?

npcs.name: Magnon Baelvurn
utterances: 'ello there. Magnon Baelvurn's the name. A dwarf in high standing with the fish lords of old!
Ah, yes. Bulvar mentioned your name, said he was sending someone down to take my spot, or do my work for me, or something along those lines.

Right, well, that's pretty much what I said. Well, let's see what you can do then, shall we? Yes we shall. There are some gnolls quite a ways west of here. Boring, shiftless lot if you study 'em much, and I did. They don't amount to much yet, but I still keep an eye on 'em.

But yer fluffy lads directly south of here, now there's an active bunch. I think I saw them hiding some boxes once, long ago. They may not know they're being watched, but they are paranoid regardless. And the grubs... that's the confusing part.

Aye, they've got soil rich with these strange grubs out in front of their cave. They're out there collecting these things all day and all night. I've never seen them eating them--and I've seen these dogs eat--so I have no idea what they're using them for. But I'd like to find out. Naturally, <player name>, that is where you come in. Do ya feel ready?

Good! Their cave is south of here, hard to miss--especially with all those hunters parading around out front. I'd like ya to do two things. First, kill yourself some of them grub hunters. They're creepy, I tell ya. Second, collect some of those grubs for us, so we can try to figure out what they're using them for.
And be careful! That cave is deep, who knows what lurks down in there. Just stay out front for now. That's what I would do, anyway.
Well, what have ya got?
Great work! I'll start working on these right away. We'll see what we can figure out. While I'm doing that I have a task for you.

Lord Kylar sent word to me. His son was out practicing some swordplay and was abducted by gnolls. He received a very poorly written ransom note, which is good because it means the lad is alive. Gnolls have never been proper negotiators, in fact I'd wager hostages are harmed more often when negotiations are attempted. The best way to save that young man would be to find him and kill his captors.

Aye. It shouldn't prove too difficult. Just don't give the gnolls enough time to think. If you attack, they'll jump on ya, it's their nature. Lord Kylar says he knows where the gnolls are, so you should report to him. You can find him at the Keep of the Ardent Needle. It's west of here.
Come back once you've helped him out, I'll get to work on these grubs right away.
How did it go?
As I suspected you would. I am glad to hear it.

Nothing, it would seem. I tested them for any imbued magic and the like and came up empty handed. They are very effective at catching fish, though. Perhaps the gnolls were using them for that. Really, though, they might be eating them. Keep in mind, these gnolls are astonishingly boring to watch. I had hoped to find something in the grubs, but did not.
Hardly! This is the best fishing I've had in weeks! Are you ready to continue your assignment?

Good. I've spotted more of those fabled crates I spoke of prior. There was no mistaking it this time, the gnolls are definitely keeping supplies within the cave. What I managed to get a hold of myself was, as I suspected, worthless, sundry gnollstuff. No use to anyone, save the gnolls. So I'd like you to take care of it.

Head into their cave and make a mess of it! There are Cavemaw tunnelers and tamers in there and I want you to take them out as you hit the supplies. You shouldn't have to go very deep, yet still it will put a rather large dent in their situation here. Not enough to scare them off, but enough to help us out in the long run.
I know you can. Come back to me once you're done, I'm working on a plan that will take us deeper into those caves.
Did ya get 'em?
Good... good.
No, actually...

I don't know, honestly. Word came down from Bulvar. He doesn't want me--or you for that matter--messing around in that cave any longer. He didn't give any reason, he just told me it was important. I trust him, but I certainly am confused by it. I'm sure he'll tell me soon enough. Perhaps you'll know before I do! He asked me to ask if you would be willing to speak with him. Are you?

He'll be glad of it. You can find him easy enough in the Keep of the Gnollslayers. Head east along the shore to the Oracle Tower griffin station. From there hop a griffin to the Steppes station. Once you land, head north you'll come to the keep. Bulvar will be waiting for ya.
Thanks to Bulvar I now have plenty of time to fish! And these blessed grubs work great! Thanks again, <player name>.
I don't think I eat as much as I should.

npcs.name: Maratis Jyd
utterances: Greetings, friend. Safe travels to you.

npcs.name: Matsy Rollingpin
utterances: I can not thank you enough! Here, please have some of these wonderful cookies to brighten your day.
Let's see now. Salt, good stock... I will need to brown that flour and... Oh, hello there!
I'm making a lovely, warm chowder to share with those in need. However, I seem to have forgotten an ingredient. Could you be a doll and run an errand for me?
I need you to purchase some pepper from Merchant Novak and bring it back here. She makes her stand out by the lighthouse near the docks.
Be as swift as you can...  I wouldn't want my roux to clump!
Oh my! Pepper! That is exactly what I needed! Here, eat something. You look flush. Have you seen my ladle?
So many things cooking on the stove...  If you have time, I have other errands that need to be tended to. I'd be happy to feed you!
So many hungry folks. I am afraid I haven't made enough for everyone! If you want to eat, you'll need to fetch me some extra Coldwind fish so I can stir up another pot.
Wonderful! I'll be waiting for your return.
Excellent work! You even cleaned them for me! Here, have some lovely chowder and make yourself at home.
If there is one thing wholesome, it's a hot dish.  It warms the stomach and the soul.  That, and it helps those who have partaken of the good ale a bit heavily as well.  Please, take this to Aroof.
If he doesn't sober up we will be needing more than food to save him!
Well now, there is a lot less ruckus going on down there. Perhaps the stew helped. You look famished... Here, grab a spoon!

You have been so helpful today! My cousin, Blarton Blumble, has happened on some terrible luck and broke his leg while fishing. He is the sad sack today and in such a terrible mood. If you could deliver these lovely cookies to him for me, there will be plenty for you when you return!
Bless your heart.

npcs.name: Mayor Woodbridge
utterances: Well, since you're going to listen in you may as well join the conversation.  Ahhh, get out of here before it gets rough for ya!

npcs.name: Merle Trevine
utterances: Hello.

npcs.name: Millennial Hall
utterances: The puppets are ready, are you?

npcs.name: Mister Jumtum
utterances: Pfft!  Away with you, or you'll step on my flowers!

npcs.name: Nault
utterances: Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.
I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.
Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.

npcs.name: a Necrosis auger
utterances: We no can win, must flee!
What I do now?
I think run is good idea now.
It hurt! It hurt! Make it stop!
Run away! These ones too strong!

npcs.name: a Necrosis conscript
utterances: I think run is good idea now.
Go away! We let you live if you leave stuff.
We no can win, must flee!
It hurt! It hurt! Make it stop!
Run away! These ones too strong!
What I do now?

npcs.name: a Necrosis shrew
utterances: It hurt! It hurt! Make it stop!
We no can win, must flee!
Go away! We let you live if you leave stuff.
Run away! These ones too strong!
What I do now?

npcs.name: Noa Sails
utterances: Keep your distance, friend. We have important cargo here. Step any closer and I'll have to pummel you ... and you don't want me to leave you stranded out here, do ya?
Oh, then you want to speak with Rusty.

npcs.name: Novak
utterances: Greetings, perhaps you need to replenish your supplies, or maybe just sell some of what you picked up along the trail?

npcs.name: Old Man McQuibble
utterances: What?

npcs.name: Oracle Ednar
utterances: There is something different about you.
I sense that you still have much to do before your destiny is complete.
Your fate will shape the future of this world.

npcs.name: Oracle Liandrin
utterances: The view from here is amazing, isn't it?  I could gaze out these windows for hours.  Sometimes I do.  Ah, the beauty of Antonica ...

npcs.name: Oracle Ulinara
utterances: It appeared in the Karma Pool, while I was in trance. I saw it! So beautiful.
I am sorry, but we are having a private meeting.  This is no concern of yours.

Wait!  Please do not go. You ... you may be of use to us. I want to find the tree I saw and confirm its location. Unfortunately, I must remain here in the tower with my studies. Would you please help me?

When I peered into the Karma Pool, I saw a constellation of stars that told me where the tree could be found.  Go to the heart of a region called the Thundering Steppes, near the natives.  You will seek a tree within a tree -- one dead and one alive.  When you find it, take a Golden Acorn from its branches and return to me.

npcs.name: an overland miner
utterances: There they are! Let's get em!
Go on now, I'll hold them!
You'll never take me alive!

npcs.name: an overland woodcutter
utterances: You angered the spirits of the woods for the last time.
You cannot kill us all, despoiler!
My friend may have fallen like a rotten tree but I will not.

npcs.name: Perinius Abatro
utterances: How do you do?
Hello there!

npcs.name: a plaguebringer acolyte
utterances: All hands retreat!

npcs.name: Protector Emerson
utterances: I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.
Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!
Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.
Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Protector Hawes
utterances: I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.
Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.
Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!

npcs.name: Protector Swithin
utterances: I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.
Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: Protector Wickham
utterances: Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.
I hate working this shift!  If the gnolls don't attack now, I may die of boredom.

npcs.name: Quallium
utterances: Oh look at the mess I am in! My thoughts of wonderment have been stolen from me.

They have my scrolls ... my poems! I was just sitting upon the isles, like I always do, searching for inspiration, when all of the sudden they appeared! I ran and now have lost my scrolls to the howling beasts.
Will you?! Oh! Thank you! Search them well, yes, search them very well. I know my scrolls are being clutched by those furry paws!
You saved me! These scrolls will take me from being a simple wordsmith to a legendary poet. You have read my work, have you not?
Well of course you did! You should really visit the sights I wrote about. All four poems were based on actual images I spied from the isle. I am such a genius! Here, read for yourself!

npcs.name: Quigley
utterances: Hello, friend. Welcome to my shop.
Good day, adventurer. Care to take a look at my merchandise?

npcs.name: Rathford
utterances: Well met.

npcs.name: Revyl Kylar
utterances: Thank you! If you could lead me back to my father I would be grateful. I don't have much strength left in me and if I couldn't fend them off before I'm certain I couldn't now.
You dirty, filthy dog! Stay away!
Father!
I still don't know what they wanted with me.

npcs.name: Riason Hanagom
utterances: What brings you here? I'm VERY busy.
That worm has been delaying for long enough.  It's about time he did his job. What are you waiting for!? Give it to me!
Gah!  I could kill you right here and now for defying me.  Here, take this and give me the letter NOW!
To arms!
Favor?!  You demanded money for that "favor" as I recall.  Besides, that man is no "friend" of mine.  He was merely doing a little... research for me.  Now leave me alone!

Bah!  You are very annoying, you know that?  However, you are persistent and brave... or perhaps just stupid.  In any case, I could make use of you and it would save me some time.  Cooper found out the general location of a recently discovered shrine from a few adventurers.  I was going to check it out myself but I have other... business to attend to.  Go and find it and I'll throw a few coins your way.
Cooper's letter said the shrine is at the southern edge of the Thundering Steppes.  That's quite a journey for someone like you, and I won't shed a tear if you do not return.

npcs.name: Rikantus
utterances: My camp is your camp,  traveler. Sit, sit ... rest a spell. Perhaps the evils of the countryside will subside whilst you warm your belly with some eidolon stew.

Do not fear Evernight Cemetery. It is nothing but an old forgotten plot of land now. Nothing to fear here. The dead have long since dug their way out and found their way home or found their way to vengeance. Now how about that stew? My best batch yet.
I'm glad you asked. I am a trader of rare trinkets and a haggler of oddities. Only within the undiscovered territories will I find lost treasures the likes of which attract only the highest profits.

Profit is not always measured in the tangible. I carry only the rarest of goods and require the greatest of value in trade. Often times the most valuable possessions cannot be contained within a coin purse. Perhaps we can haggle?

You are not ready to behold one of my curios, but we may well have business to discuss. You are an explorer, an adventurer of the wilds. I am but an old man with a walking stick. Help me and I will offer you a sliver of wonder ... a trinket more priceless than all the platinum on Norrath.

I desire a trinket for a trinket, a stolen vault of knowledge. Within the depths of the Sabertooth lair resides a tome bound of gnoll hide and scribed in the black blood of Norrath. Find and return this tome to me, and I shall grant you wonders of time long past. Find me the Scrawlings of Chirannis.
The Scrawlings of Chirannis are mine yet again. Never shall we let it drift from embrace until the cursed words and foul creed are needed again.

The scratches within this ghastly tome have traveled far to meet the ears of gnolls. It speaks to them of origins and guides them to a foreboding destiny. The gnolls regard this as their newfound highest writ from the dog lord, Chirannis.  They shall be very displeased that the sacred words were stolen from their lair.
Here is your reward, a trinket from my personal vaults. It may appear old and tattered, but the wisdom within shall lead to great fortune.

npcs.name: Roslyn Mischeva
utterances: What are you doing, <player name>? Let's go! It's time to slay the dragon!
And so, our intrepid hero returns, after having defeated one of the terrible terrors of Norrath!
Yes you did! With style and panache, no less! You must want your well earned reward now, and so you shall have it!

And just because you have completed this quest, does not mean that the danger to Norrath is over! Oh no! It has just begun! You are welcome to continue to hunt for us and our monstrous puppets for as long as the Heroes' Festival runs!
Now go, and be heroic!
That was a fun fight!

npcs.name: Rusty Sails
utterances: Hail yourself, stranger.  State your purpose, or be on your way.
Well, I'm glad she sent someone.  The attacks have been constant, and we've lost too many able bodies to withstand another attack ...  What in Thule!?  Another wave of Marauders!
There's no way we would've withstood that attack without your help.  We can make it the rest of the way from here.  Let the Captain know the attacks have increased.

npcs.name: a Sabertooth battler
utterances: Kill it!  Kill it!
Spin, weave, dodge, attack!!!
Another member of the pack down!
You gonna pay for that.
That one will never mate!
That one never mate!
That one died.
I must fight for Sabertooth pride.
You gonna die so fast!

npcs.name: a Sabertooth camp guard
utterances: To arms!
Kill it!  Kill it!
You gonna die so fast!
You gonna pay for that.
That one died.

npcs.name: a Sabertooth captor
utterances: That one died.
You gonna pay for that.

npcs.name: a Sabertooth darkstrider
utterances: Kill it!  Kill it!
Bite! Show sharp teeth!
You gonna die so fast!
That one died.
You gonna pay for that.
Spin, weave, dodge, attack!!!
Another member of the pack down!

npcs.name: a Sabertooth elder
utterances: Another member of the pack down!
You gonna pay for that.
That one died.
Bite! Show sharp teeth!
Kill it!  Kill it!

npcs.name: a Sabertooth Hero
utterances: I'll rip your throat open!

npcs.name: a Sabertooth neophyte
utterances: You gonna pay for that.
That one died.
Kill it!  Kill it!
To arms!

npcs.name: a Sabertooth Pack Lord
utterances: Bite! Show sharp teeth!
Another member of the pack down!

npcs.name: a Sabertooth rune caster
utterances: Kill it!  Kill it!
Spin, weave, dodge, attack!!!
Another member of the pack down!
You gonna pay for that.
That one died.
I must fight for Sabertooth pride.
Not allowed here!
You gonna die so fast!

npcs.name: a Sabertooth runt
utterances: Kill it!  Kill it!
That one died.
You're stronger than me.
You gonna pay for that.
You gonna die so fast!
I must fight for Sabertooth pride.
To arms!

npcs.name: a Sabertooth spear guard
utterances: You gonna die so fast!
You gonna pay for that.
To arms!
That one died.
Kill it!  Kill it!

npcs.name: a Sabertooth tormentor
utterances: You gonna pay for that.
That one died.

npcs.name: Scholar Al'Quylar
utterances: How in the name of Al'Kabor am I going to power this?
It's this black chunk of marble, you see.  I'm quite curious about it, and have been investigating a way to power it.
The stone has strange markings. I've traced the markings to ancient magical runes that invoke a spell of warding.
I must confess; I'm not certain.  It could've warded off any number of things in previous ages; things long lost to us.
I would say so, yes.  Likely quite a good bit before.  Do you mind helping me research the stone?

Oh, by all means, I'll pay you for your efforts.  While I understand that some people do things out of the goodness of their heart, I think everyone should be concerned with payment for services rendered!

npcs.name: Seamus Rockpounder
utterances: When ya come out of the bar bring us more ale!

npcs.name: Selinda Whispersong
utterances: If you're looking for a challenge, you might want to speak with Cru Naseto, and he'll explain our circuit.

npcs.name: Sentry Acton
utterances: Watch yourself out here. All kinds of bad things can happen - never know when a gnoll might sneak up behind ya and ... GRAB ya!
Watch yourself out here. All kinds of bad things can happen - never know when a gnoll might sneak up behind ya and  ... GRAB ya!

npcs.name: Sentry Elmsley
utterances: Keep your eyes open. Bandits have been seen on the road ahead.
Keep your eyes open.  Bandits have been seen on the road ahead.

npcs.name: Sergeant Tillin
utterances: Hah!  We've so many adventurers out these days that I think the gnolls decided to push back a bit.  We heard that they're plotting inside Blackburrow.  Think you could help us out?
Hoy! You look right strong, care to do a job for the guard?

npcs.name: Sighard Sayer
utterances: Welcome, welcome. Please look about. Speak to my merchants; they're quite helpful.
Ah! Dancer the frontiersman ... er ... I mean frontierslady as she says. Here, here. This is for her, an arrow like few others, an arrow she is expecting.

npcs.name: Sir Dinzzie
utterances: Well look at you! I wonder, would you be able to defeat him?
Ahh, Vindiami the Ancient. I'm afraid that the Necrosis goblin clan will figure out how to wake him from his slumber and then... WHAM! He'll go on a rampage in Qeynos.
Yep, you need to go into the Condemned Catacombs and figure out how to wake and slay the beast. Good luck, you're going to need all of it you can get.

npcs.name: Sir Hegel Hammerheart
utterances: Hello there!  I trust your travels are treating you well!

npcs.name: Sir Jeager
utterances: Greetings! Can I help you with something?
Well, be careful, or the Sabertooth clan will have you for dinner.

npcs.name: Sleepwalk Ashier
utterances: This scenario was a breeze to pen! It practically wrote itself!

npcs.name: a small skeletal brat
utterances: Rest in peace.
Final death comes at last.
Your blood calls to me.

npcs.name: Snekf Blacksmelter
utterances: Pass some more ale!

npcs.name: a sogbone skeleton
utterances: As I rise from the grave,  you will now take my place!
That pile of bones was my friend!

npcs.name: Soldier Homrie
utterances: Please, someone help me!  One of those ... blasted gnolls got me ... with a poison arrow.  Don't know how much time I have.

npcs.name: Soldier Pellenos
utterances: Hello there!  Come for tea?  I'm sorry, but I'm completely out of sugar!  Ask the gnolls; they killed everyone here.  Yes, everyone ... but me.  And now I don't know where the teapot is.  But there's no sugar, so it doesn't matter.  Hee hee!

npcs.name: Soldier Selennia
utterances: Listen ... I only have a few minutes left.  Tell the commander ... the gnolls came from behind ... they took all of us out ... Arthur ... Garrin ... Dalathani ... the Greenleaf triplets.  And even little Skimpy!  Those fiends! They even killed Skimpy! I've lost too much ... blood. Tell him ... what happened.

npcs.name: Sparrow Cogcarrier
utterances: Avast ye blaggard! What's ye be wanting?
Arrr! I be the drea' pirate Sparrow... an' who might ye be?
Yar matey, me captain and me crew seem ta be in a spot of trouble, we do.
We'll discuss the terms of that after ye do me a simple favor. Ye see, I'll be needing ye ta dig up a treasure me gran'pappy left behin' fa' me.

Gran'! Tis a great day ta be a gnome pirate. Take that multidirectional aerospanning locationater over there ta locate me treasure... Gar! An' don't ye be forgetting me truste' shovel. Come back once ye got me treasure!

npcs.name: Squire Kivan
utterances: Are you hungry? I'm making soup.
I'm Kivan, Sir Jeager's squire and faithful servant. We're here to fight the insidious Sabertooth clan.
Sir Jeager is the most honorable of all the Royal Antonican Guards. He alone was assigned to fight off the Sabertooth clan.  He's a leader among leaders and a brave soldier.
They're a clan of vicious gnolls. They infest the hills around here, and at night they prey on the children of Qeynos. We must stop them!
It seems that politics and honesty do not mix. One of the Queen's advisors did not like something Sir Jeager said. So, here we are.
Yes. You can help us. The Sabertooth clan is getting ore from somewhere in the hills and I need you to find out where. Bring me some mining picks to prove that you found the mine.

npcs.name: Taith McJarun
utterances: Hello friend.  Have you come to help with our research?

npcs.name: Tanen Danos
utterances: Hello there, adventurer.  You must be a mite weary from your travels.  Relax and have a drink of my personal brew.  Barbarians brew the hardiest ales you'll ever put to your lips.  You ever hear of ol' Clan McMarrin's "Blizzard Warmer?"  That'll keep you going on those cold wintry nights!

Clan McMarrin was a clan of the toughest barbarian warriors to have called dear old Halas home.  They have not been heard of for some time though.  After the Shattering they set out to find a place that barbarians could live as they did in Halas.  Word was they were looking toward the Thundering Steppes last anyone knew.
You would?  Aye, that is good to hear.  I like Qeynos and all, but us barbarians need a place we can call our own, you know?

Hello there, adventurer.  You must be a mite weary from your travels.  Relax and have a drink of my personal brew.  Barbarians brew the hardiest ales you'll ever put to your lips.  You ever hear of ole Clan McMarrin's "Blizzard Warmer?"  That'll keep you going on those cold wintry nights!

npcs.name: Tark Searfang
utterances: Go with Fippy, fallen one!

npcs.name: Taskmaster Lynette
utterances: Unless you're filling a Far Seas Requisition of Antonica I do not have time for you. Time is money.

This order is overdue!  Our policy clearly states that the Far Seas Trading Company does not pay full price for late requisitions.  Wait... I see that you are not the huntsman who was issued the order. That means I'll have to file a change of vendor form. Still, you've filled the order and that deserves compensation.  Perhaps someday we'll add you to our list of independent contractors.

The Far Seas Trading Company pays huntsmen to gather hides.  We issue a requisition order for the kind of hide we wish to buy. The huntsman takes the order and brings us the hides. We pay the huntsman for the hides; if he doesn't return, we don't pay him.  For legal purposes, the huntsman is considered a consultant for the Far Seas Trading Company and not a full-time employee; therefore, we assume no liability for the actions, expenses, or injuries of the consultant.

This is the office for processing requisition orders, not the office for employment. We have more than enough huntsmen on staff.  So, unless you happen to find an unclaimed Far Seas Requisition and fill its order... our business is done.  Good day. Next!

npcs.name: Thompson
utterances: Duty above all else, citizen, except honor!
Greetings, citizen. I am on guard duty.  Should you get into trouble, seek me out.
Good day to you, citizen. All preserve Queen Antonia.

npcs.name: a timberclaw gnoll
utterances: That one died.
You gonna pay for that.
That one never mate!
That one will never mate!
Another member of the pack down!

npcs.name: Timothus Yelrow
utterances: You ... you interrupted my meditation! Do you not know the importance of my work here?
To avoid obnoxious individuals like you from disturbing me! Well ... if you must know, I am waiting here for my associate to confirm some rumors.

Aren't you inquisitive! Not that it does you any good.  I have received information that Stormhold - the hidden fortress of the Knights of Thunder - has been found. Anyone remotely knowledgeable knows that the Knights kept a cache of large magical books of spells and incantations called tomes. But I never trust rumors. I am a man of learning, and I require a reliable witness. Therefore, I wait.

npcs.name: a traitorous farmer
utterances: The wisdom of the woods is not for you!
You will not despoil our sacred forest!
You cannot kill us all, despoiler!
My friend may have fallen like a rotten tree but I will not.

npcs.name: Tyllia Navar
utterances: What of the boat and the gnolls?
By Zek, an empty boat is worthless. At least the neophytes and runts have been slain. Their foul stench will soon return, however. I have another task for you if you're willing.

The island over there, the middle of the three--the westernmost of the two gnoll controlled islands--is far more vulnerable than its eastern twin. I know not what lingers there but I would ask that you find out. Slay the gnolls upon the island.
Return to me once this is done.
Well?
That is a relief...  And what of the island itself? Were there supplies? Perhaps a shipping port of some sort.
Then it must be on the other island... that is unfortunate. Will you go back, <player name>?

You'll have to venture to the other island. It is fortified with stronger ranks and far more dangerous. I would not recommend setting foot on it, but I believe you can still find the dock by swimming about the isle, the gnolls won't notice you then. Yes, I think that is the best bet.

As I said, if we can determine what items the gnolls are moving we are that much closer to discovering their plans... if they even have plans; I do hope the gnolls are not bent on making a more permanent residence here. However, at the docks I am certain you will find a manifest of some sort. Find it and bring it to me.
Remember, you don't need to fight the entire island. The manifest should be on or near the docks. Good luck, <player name>.
Did you get the manifest?
Thank you. Hmm... arcanic fluids? <player name>, the time to act is now. Will you continue to offer your aid?
Good. I'd like you to travel to the cave just north east of here. Find out what the gnolls are doing in there and report back to me. Bring me whatever proof you can of their activities.
Do not worry about being discreet in as much as it concerns me, but do worry about your own safety.
What have you found?

Scarecrows?! How little sense all of this makes. If the gnolls are planning an offensive why use scarecrows? I will need time to think on this. In the meantime, <player name>, Bulvar has asked a favor of you.

Aye. I spoke to him of the help you provided. He sees worth in you, <player name>. He would like that worth spent helping Magnon as you helped me. He is on the northern coast of Antonica, just west of the Oracle Tower griffin station. What do you say?
I'm glad to hear it. He will be glad of your help, I am sure.

West of here you will find the Qeynos station griffin tower. The trainer atop will gladly send you off to the Oracle Tower station. Once you land you can follow the coast west and you will come to Magnon's camp. Be well, <player name>. Thank you again for all your help.
Wonderful work! It was quite an honor to have been by your side.

npcs.name: Velric Torch
utterances: A great day for a picnic, wouldn't you say?
Despite the good in and around these lands, you still end up with places like this dark forest. Did you ever wonder why that is?
It's nice to see others out and about. My wife is such a homebody.

npcs.name: a wandering minstrel
utterances: I always stop in to have some of Lanice's delightful ale.
The townsfolk aren't as pleasant as they were during my last visit.
Buy me a drink, and I'll sing you a song.

npcs.name: Yoru the Old
utterances: Ah, there you are.  I was beginning to wonder if you would ever come speak to me.  There are great things in store for you. I have many things to teach you and my time grows short.  But first, I need firewood for my hearth.  Will you be so kind as to gather me some?
Return here when you have enough to last me the winter.  I await your return. I have much to teach you.
Did you bring the firewood I asked you to gather?

Thank you ... thank you.  Just stack it over there.  I believe you are ready now ... yes, I can see it.  But before I teach you these things, would you be so kind as to make me something to eat?  I'm very hungry and my old body grows tired quickly.
Oh, it has been a very long time since I have had anything but broth and tea.  I miss the taste of cooked meat.  Yes, if you could get me some meat, I would be very grateful.
